section_title: Extras for Riders, Families, and Spectators
section_overview: Supporting content for riders, spectators, and families during the event. Includes persona-specific extras and seasonal weather context.

seasonal_pattern.summary: Wellington’s winter season (Jan–Mar) is warm, mostly dry, with highs in the upper 70s and lows in the 60s. Afternoon showers are common but brief.
seasonal_pattern.use_in_content: Guide packing tips, scheduling advice, and family activity timing.

rider.overview: For riders focused on barn life and the show schedule.

list.item: Pack lightweight rain sheets — afternoon showers can pop up quickly.
Morning hacks are best before humidity rises mid-day.
Bring extra towels for damp tack and gear after showers.

spectator.overview: For spectators making the most of their time at WEF.

list.item: Sunscreen and hats are a must for mid-day hunter rounds.
Late GP nights can get cool — bring layers.
Plan beach trips early in the day to avoid afternoon rain.
Keep indoor options (science center, mall) for rainy afternoons.

owner_trainer.overview: Extras for owners, sponsors, and trainers.

list.item: Book dinners later in the evening to account for weather delays.
Quiet meeting spaces indoors are useful when showers move classes.
